question: In the analysis of III group basic radicals of salts, the purpose of adding <katex>$NH_{4}Cl_{(s)}$</katex> to <katex>$NH_{4}OH$</katex> is: [cite: 211, 216]
choices: To increase the concentration of OH ions.
To precipitate the radicals of group IV and V.
explanation: The common ion effect of <katex>$NH_4^+$</katex> from <katex>$NH_4Cl$</katex> suppresses the ionization of <katex>$NH_4OH$</katex>, lowering the <katex>$OH^-$</katex> concentration. This ensures only Group III hydroxides precipitate while preventing Group IV/V precipitation. [cite: 212, 213]
